solution_line_template: Of the under-30s there for the second band, 40% are men because {total_percentage}-{women_percentage}=<<{total_percentage}-{women_percentage}={men_percentage}>>{men_percentage}
There are fifty under-30s there for the second band because {num_men} / {men_percentage_decimal} = <<{num_men}/{men_percentage_decimal}={under_30_second_band_total}>>{under_30_second_band_total}

There are 100 people there to see the second band because {under_30_second_band_total} / {under_30_percent_second_band_decimal} = <<{under_30_second_band_total}/{under_30_percent_second_band_decimal}={second_band_audience_total}>>{second_band_audience_total}

There are 150 people at the concert because {second_band_audience_total} / ({second_band_fraction}) = <<{second_band_audience_total}/({second_band_fraction})={total_concert_people}>>{total_concert_people}
